text: <@U1FU2880L|gabelev> has joined the channel
<@U0S5KF44D>: <@U0Z81GL6S> is the tx.on(‘complete’) functionality working today?
It is rigged to wait for a certain period of time and then return complete. But it is not actually implemented with events.
oh ok
i had my hopes up :wink:
while I have you, a different question
I am trying to model a direct user (not user->webtier::registrar)
in earlier prototypes, I was doing .newChain, … , .getMember -> .registerAndEnroll
running this against the new SDK, this blows up when it used to work
so, I think I just need to learn what the new mechanism is
but since this is not how the examples are structured, its not clear
any advice?
(the examples all assume webtier::registrar kind of flow
(to my knowledge, at least)
Greg, if you have a user in the yaml file, you can simply call “chain.enroll(user,secret, function(err, user) { …}” to get that user.
but if you’re getting an error, let me know.  I’m not aware of anything that we broke which used to work
regarding the complete event, I thought Pat was working on that.  Is that correct?
(Thanks, I'll try that)
And I'll check with pat
I wasn't clear if the part you mentioned was ongoing was basic events or custom events
(It sounds like "both")
<@U0S5KF44D>: is there a way to view the sdk/node/doc folder online, or do you just load it as a file:// url locally?

<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F1G1BQZRT/-.sh|Untitled> and commented: This is the crash I see on hlc-0.0.9 when I call chain.getMember().  This used to work in the old SDK, FWIW.

initial_comment.comment: This is the crash I see on hlc-0.0.9 when I call chain.getMember().  This used to work in the old SDK, FWIW.

text: high level guess: self.keyValueStore == nil, but Im not sure why as I set it prior to the call
investigating now
<@U0S5KF44D>: nm, i figured it out

(in case curious, old api had hlc.createKeyValueStore() and new api replaced that with setKevValueStore() but i didn’t notice it no longer took a path string as input)  FYI in case that trips someone else up
